page.title: 10Ravenfield Village
page.content: The old village is a{quiet place}which has changed a little bit but not much. On the main road it hasn't changed but on some backroads there are lots of new houses.Down the road there is{St. {James church.}Some people call it the {'Bull and Bush',}because the man who owned it had a pub called the Bull and Bush in London.The church has{ogee {shaped windows}and a{steeple.}It was built in{1756.}The{clock}has{one hand. There are some{fish ponds}near the village and you need a special permit to fish there.{Ravenfield Common}has a {tennis court,a garage,a post office and{a public house.}I like the village and I would very much like to live there when I am older. I enjoy fishing so I could walk down the road to the fish ponds. I think I would need some form of transport because the nearest shops are at Ravenfield Common.
